lines: At Datadog, I worked as an intern on the Reference Tables team.
Reference Tables is a multipurpose addition to Datadog’s observability tools.
The product is primarily used for adding context to the logs of large scale applications.
When I joined the team, Reference Tables was being prepared for its beta release.
At the start of the summer, I used Datadog’s Synthetic Tests platform to design recurring tests for Reference Tables’ publicly facing API.
The tests would run automatically multiple times each day to confirm API endpoints were live and behaving as expected.
For the rest of my internship, I worked with many of Reference Tables’ microservices.
These were written in Go and python, and required edits and improvements throughout the summer.
My coworkers were very supportive as I learned the concepts behind microservice architectures.
I enjoyed working on a team and contributing to a real-world product!
